titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: Godfrey reports that Mrs Thorpe is distressingly ill. I attended Mattins & Evensong, wrote a sermon, & several letters: walked with Elizabeth, & saw the finest rainbow I ever remember.
Fifty lbs. of tea arrived from Twinings. This ought to see me through the winter. With a fire & a cup of tea one can bear much!
